title: Russia Facing Military Shortcomings in Ukraine Invasion, Says U.S. Intelligence Chief
sub_head: Avril Haines tells House committee that Russia will be hard-pressed to control territory and install a pro-Moscow regime
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”Russia is facing serious military shortcomings in its invasion of Ukraine, including morale and logistical problems, and will be hard-pressed to control territory and install a pro-Moscow regime in the face of a persistent and significant Ukrainian insurgency, Director of National Intelligence Avril Haines said Tuesday.
Ms. Haines and other intelligence-agency chiefs told the House Intelligence Committee that Russian President Vladimir Putinhad hoped to seize the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv within two days in a lightning strike that would have short-circuited attempts by the West to aid the country.
